text: Robert J. Walker (known as Bob Walker; February 2, 1929 - February 15, 2016) was an American sailor. He was the third Master Chief Petty Officer of the Navy. On September 26, 1975, Walker was sworn in as the third Master Chief Petty Officer of the Navy. Walker was a much more conservative, traditional MCPON than his predecessor, John Whittet. He retired in the 1980s. Walker was born in Baldwin, New York. He attended a grammar and high school in Oxford, New York. Walker died of complications from pneumonia in Norfolk, Virginia. He was aged 87. ==References== ==Other websites== * Extensive bio at quarterdeck.org * Three Stars and a Crow Category:1929 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Military people from New York (state) Category:People from New York (state)
title: Robert J. Walker (sailor)
